title: How to dilute 30% hydrogen peroxide to 6% hydrogen peroxide - Quora

response.answer_text: Remember that mass can’t be generated or destroyed. The same amount of pure H2O2 exist before and after the dilution. That gives the equation: 30/100 x H2O2 = 6/100 x (H2O2 + H2O) or 0.3a = 0.06a + 0.06b b = 4 a Add 4 times the volume of water.
Take 1 volume of the 30% and add 4 volumes of water, and the result will be 1/5 the 30% or 6%. Oz, mL or gallons, it’s all the same as long as the units for both measures are the same.
